metadata.name: Indirect Command Execution From Script File Via Bash.EXE
metadata.comment: Detects execution of Microsoft bash launcher without any flags to execute the content of a bash script directly. This can be used to potentially bypass defenses and execute Linux or Windows-based binaries directly via bash.

batch.sql: SELECT * FROM process_activity WHERE time BETWEEN CURRENT_TIMESTAMP() - INTERVAL 24 HOUR AND CURRENT_TIMESTAMP() AND (lower(activity_id) = lower('1') AND (endswith(lower(process.name), lower(':\\windows\\system32\\bash.exe')) OR endswith(lower(process.name), lower(':\\windows\\syswow64\\bash.exe'))) AND lower(process.file.name) = lower('bash.exe') AND NOT (contains(lower(process.cmd_line), lower('bash.exe -')) OR contains(lower(process.cmd_line), lower('bash -')) OR process.cmd_line is null OR lower(process.cmd_line) = lower('') OR lower(LOWER(process.cmd_line)) in ('bash\.exe', 'bash')))

output.summary: Detects execution of Microsoft bash launcher without any flags to execute the content of a bash script directly. This can be used to potentially bypass defenses and execute Linux or Windows-based binaries directly via bash.

metadata.objective: False positive: Unknown References: https://lolbas-project.github.io/lolbas/Binaries/Bash/, https://linux.die.net/man/1/bash, Internal Research
